snippet.textDisplay: I greatly enjoy this game for what it is, largely as a one-and-done experience. The designs are solid and the music is great. Shame its basically a 3DS game on the Switch, especially after getting showed up by BoTW and Mario Odyssey.
snippet.textOriginal: I greatly enjoy this game for what it is, largely as a one-and-done experience. The designs are solid and the music is great. Shame its basically a 3DS game on the Switch, especially after getting showed up by BoTW and Mario Odyssey.

snippet.textDisplay: Fun game, raids were cool with friends as a coop thing to do besides just battling each other. Good character designs and music. Liked the balance of pokemon new and returning. Dynamaxing is a cool mechanic. I actually enjoyed the story with how it didn't shoehorn in the world is in danger and made it more like a sports thing. Though the end part had to dip it's toe in. The initial wild area was ok, though the DLC area started to go in a better direction with more varied areas. The game also made some nice changes for competitive play. It's a pretty good entry following Sun and Moon.
snippet.textOriginal: Fun game, raids were cool with friends as a coop thing to do besides just battling each other. Good character designs and music. Liked the balance of pokemon new and returning. Dynamaxing is a cool mechanic. I actually enjoyed the story with how it didn't shoehorn in the world is in danger and made it more like a sports thing. Though the end part had to dip it's toe in. The initial wild area was ok, though the DLC area started to go in a better direction with more varied areas. The game also made some nice changes for competitive play. It's a pretty good entry following Sun and Moon.

snippet.textDisplay:
The only Pokemon game that I currently give a shit these days is New Pokemon Snap. Hell, I was 5 years old when the original Pokemon Snap came out for the Nintendo 64 back in 1999. I just turned 27 this month.
Man, first Club House Games, then Pokemon Snap, and I know were suppose to be getting a new Wave Race game for the Switch since Shinya Takahashi hinted that, but what about F-Zero, Star Tropics, 1080, or even Sin & Punishment?
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: For me it's simple: the game was way too EASY! no replayability or anything, even though some of the areas etc. gave off a great classic Pokémon vibe. Plus, the wild area was a good idea but executed too blandly.
snippet.textOriginal: For me it's simple: the game was way too EASY! no replayability or anything, even though some of the areas etc. gave off a great classic Pokémon vibe. Plus, the wild area was a good idea but executed too blandly.

snippet.textDisplay: @LordRoto hmmm, I get where you're coming from. However, it is widely accepted under game reviewers that the games have become even easier in the last few editions. Things like standard exp-shares and trainer/wild pokemon levels that track your progress and consistently go under your own ratings is just too much for me, even for (like you said) a game that isn't meant to be a grind. In my opinion there should be some sort of difficulty level, how hard could that be? Some small AI-tweaks and general level scaling and you're done :)
snippet.textOriginal: @LordRoto hmmm, I get where you're coming from. However, it is widely accepted under game reviewers that the games have become even easier in the last few editions. Things like standard exp-shares and trainer/wild pokemon levels that track your progress and consistently go under your own ratings is just too much for me, even for (like you said) a game that isn't meant to be a grind. In my opinion there should be some sort of difficulty level, how hard could that be? Some small AI-tweaks and general level scaling and you're done :)

snippet.textDisplay: @LordRoto There's a vast difference between "I need to catch a variety of pokemon and know type matchups to win" and "I can easily get a lvl 100 pokemon before the first gym and almost sleepwalk through the game". EXP candies utterly obliterated all sense of progression in the game regarding a pokemons growth. Rare candies worked because they were RARE.
snippet.textOriginal: @LordRoto There's a vast difference between "I need to catch a variety of pokemon and know type matchups to win" and "I can easily get a lvl 100 pokemon before the first gym and almost sleepwalk through the game". EXP candies utterly obliterated all sense of progression in the game regarding a pokemons growth. Rare candies worked because they were RARE.

snippet.textDisplay:
Every pokemon game will be easy. It's an RPG series for kids. The difficulty will always come from playing other people. That's why all the hard core people get into the competitive scene.

But don't lie to yourself. Pokemon has never been challenging. Its just when you started playing it you didn't know the mechanics like type advantages and moves to use.

Literally the reason Nuzlock runs started was to create restrictions to make the games challenging.

snippet.textDisplay: Now that it's been out for quite a while, what's the general verdict on this game? I feel like the first impressions were largely negative before its release, then were quite positive shortly after it came out, and are now back to being mostly negative. What do you guys think? The soundtrack seems quite solid but the graphics are very bland. I haven't played it myself, but it does feel like Game Freak could have put more effort/budget behind the game. In the end though, they know the games will keep selling anyways.

The soundtrack seems quite solid but the graphics are very bland. I haven't played it myself, but it does feel like Game Freak could have put more effort/budget behind the game. In the end though, they know the games will keep selling anyways.

snippet.textDisplay: I really enjoyed it. It was too fast during the league challenge and the full game was pretty short and not challenging at all, but the graphics were incredible, most of the soundtrack was pretty good, the new mechanics were fun and the characters were very fun and lovable, so I had a fun time!

It was too fast during the league challenge and the full game was pretty short and not challenging at all, but the graphics were incredible, most of the soundtrack was pretty good, the new mechanics were fun and the characters were very fun and lovable, so I had a fun time!

snippet.textDisplay:
This game was certainly a mixed bag for me. There were a few highlights (music to stow on side, and fight with the dragon gym leader among them). The Wild Area is a cool idea and I definitely spent a ton of time there before even facing the first gym. Rivals were fun-good personalities. And despite the loss of half the Pokédex, there were plenty of mon to catch for a first play through.

It was a fine game, really. And yet it still felt...off a bit. It’s hard to explain but I feel like HG/SS and B/W/B2/W2 is where the series was at its best. So what didn’t this game do well? Very little side stuff. No Pokethlon, Safari Zone, Dream World, Contests, etc. Not much of a post game (again, sans dlc). Gym battles mostly felt too easy (wild battles were more of a challenge at times).
snippet.textOriginal:
This game was certainly a mixed bag for me. There were a few highlights (music to stow on side, and fight with the dragon gym leader among them). The Wild Area is a cool idea and I definitely spent a ton of time there before even facing the first gym. Rivals were fun-good personalities. And despite the loss of half the Pokédex, there were plenty of mon to catch for a first play through.

It was a fine game, really. And yet it still felt...off a bit. It’s hard to explain but I feel like HG/SS and B/W/B2/W2 is where the series was at its best. So what didn’t this game do well? Very little side stuff. No Pokethlon, Safari Zone, Dream World, Contests, etc. Not much of a post game (again, sans dlc). Gym battles mostly felt too easy (wild battles were more of a challenge at times).

snippet.textDisplay:
It's frustrating because it has some good things going for it but just reeks of a super rushed game that could be so much more but isn't due to the incessant "need" to churn them out every single year. Upping the price tag by $20 while offering far less content and features than previous installments is just laughable

It's disheartening when you look at how evolutionary other IPs like Mario, Zelda, Fire Emblem, and Animal Crossing have been on the Switch but then you got Pokémon looking and feeling like an upscaled 3DS game

snippet.textDisplay: It was underbaked, but showed off a lot of potential for Pokemon on console. It's a shame they didn't blow it out of the water with the first Pokemon console game, but I'm hopeful they will address a lot of the weaknesses in SwSh

snippet.textDisplay:
The pokemon games have been getting worse and worse in quality ever since they went 3D and Sword/Shield was no exception. I ended up quitting before I even got my first badge, refunding it and just watching someone else stream it. ATROCIOUS dialogue, plot writing (I've never wished death on a pokemon NPC before but congratulations for being the first, Hop),  dungeons and exploration, mediocre graphics and an archaic battle system that refuses to evolve forcing you to click through tons of textboxes that could easily be streamlined and the fact that game balance was zero thanks to raids and EXP candies removing any and all challenge from the game. Then of course you have Dexit as the big red nose on this clown of a game.
The original burst of positive impressions were from blind fanboys and people who were just happy to play another pokemon and thus willing to overlook its many MANY flaws but time has removed that outlook and most people are now judging it objectively. If this game didn't have the pokemon brand on it but kept everything else, it would have been panned for the mediocre trash it is from the start but it's nice to see most people opening their eyes now.
snippet.textOriginal:
The pokemon games have been getting worse and worse in quality ever since they went 3D and Sword/Shield was no exception. I ended up quitting before I even got my first badge, refunding it and just watching someone else stream it. ATROCIOUS dialogue, plot writing (I've never wished death on a pokemon NPC before but congratulations for being the first, Hop),  dungeons and exploration, mediocre graphics and an archaic battle system that refuses to evolve forcing you to click through tons of textboxes that could easily be streamlined and the fact that game balance was zero thanks to raids and EXP candies removing any and all challenge from the game. Then of course you have Dexit as the big red nose on this clown of a game.
The original burst of positive impressions were from blind fanboys and people who were just happy to play another pokemon and thus willing to overlook its many MANY flaws but time has removed that outlook and most people are now judging it objectively. If this game didn't have the pokemon brand on it but kept everything else, it would have been panned for the mediocre trash it is from the start but it's nice to see most people opening their eyes now.

the game is good enough for a pokemon game, pokemon games in general are like 10 years behind tho
it improves upon most other pokemon games but the cut of the dex is a BIG no go, so far it looks like the second DLC might add most of the still missing mons hopefully? The first DLC and pokemon Home release gave us a good bunch tho, just hoping we get the rest and the second DLC adds something worth while because once you finished the game there is nothing really to work towards to.

the game is good enough for a pokemon game, pokemon games in general are like 10 years behind tho
it improves upon most other pokemon games but the cut of the dex is a BIG no go, so far it looks like the second DLC might add most of the still missing mons hopefully? The first DLC and pokemon Home release gave us a good bunch tho, just hoping we get the rest and the second DLC adds something worth while because once you finished the game there is nothing really to work towards to.

snippet.textDisplay: I play competitive. The game itself was decent, but gens 2-5 are still far better by comparison. I can say that comp got 1,000,000 times easier to get into. The music is still great, I also like Marnie 1 and Gym Leader’s themes. As for new Pokémon, they weren’t bad! Only complaints were Yamper’s evolution, Calyrex, maybe a few shinies, and the ability Libero on Cinderace.
snippet.textOriginal: I play competitive. The game itself was decent, but gens 2-5 are still far better by comparison. I can say that comp got 1,000,000 times easier to get into. The music is still great, I also like Marnie 1 and Gym Leader’s themes. As for new Pokémon, they weren’t bad! Only complaints were Yamper’s evolution, Calyrex, maybe a few shinies, and the ability Libero on Cinderace.

snippet.textDisplay: It's mid. Straight down the middle for me. Love the region, music's good and I like a lot of the Pokemon. How they handled the Pokemon League was great and I love a lot of the characters (especially the gym leaders). Graphically it's lagging beyond way too much to ignore and there's a bunch of weird gameplay quirks that prevent it from being better. Isle of Armor is a good step up though.
snippet.textOriginal: It's mid. Straight down the middle for me. Love the region, music's good and I like a lot of the Pokemon. How they handled the Pokemon League was great and I love a lot of the characters (especially the gym leaders). Graphically it's lagging beyond way too much to ignore and there's a bunch of weird gameplay quirks that prevent it from being better. Isle of Armor is a good step up though.

snippet.textDisplay: An open-world 3D pokemon game was enough for me to enjoy it, but also a lot of wasted potential and not much longevity. Good music though. Hopefully the next gen improves a lot on the rest of the game.
snippet.textOriginal: An open-world 3D pokemon game was enough for me to enjoy it, but also a lot of wasted potential and not much longevity. Good music though. Hopefully the next gen improves a lot on the rest of the game.

snippet.textDisplay: Marnie's Theme might just be my favorite in the whole history of the series.
snippet.textOriginal: Marnie's Theme might just be my favorite in the whole history of the series.

snippet.textDisplay: I liked the music, but yeah, it felt very underwhelming considering the console leap. Once I beat the game I played for a couple weeks and then got bored.
snippet.textOriginal: I liked the music, but yeah, it felt very underwhelming considering the console leap. Once I beat the game I played for a couple weeks and then got bored.

snippet.textDisplay:
Having played only a tiny bit, my 2¢:
the locales are aesthetically pleasing; the art is technically the best we have seen in any Pokémon game to date—despite not being as jaw-droppingly gorgeous as the Switch can actually handle—yet stays close to the series' established art style and doesn't vary too wildly from Sun & Moon in appearance (though unambitious, this more effectively establishes it as a sequel than a reboot); the music was really good; and the gameplay was still solid—it's not any worse than in any of the previous games, though it doesn't really raise the bar, either.

In conclusion, I would give it 8/10. Good for what it is but lacks a certain je ne sais quoi.
snippet.textOriginal:
Having played only a tiny bit, my 2¢:
the locales are aesthetically pleasing; the art is technically the best we have seen in any Pokémon game to date—despite not being as jaw-droppingly gorgeous as the Switch can actually handle—yet stays close to the series' established art style and doesn't vary too wildly from Sun & Moon in appearance (though unambitious, this more effectively establishes it as a sequel than a reboot); the music was really good; and the gameplay was still solid—it's not any worse than in any of the previous games, though it doesn't really raise the bar, either.

In conclusion, I would give it 8/10. Good for what it is but lacks a certain je ne sais quoi.

snippet.textDisplay: I think fans were expecting a true change to the formula since this was the first main entry to be released for a home console. In that regard it was kind of a disappointment, but it’s not a bad game, just more of the same.
snippet.textOriginal: I think fans were expecting a true change to the formula since this was the first main entry to be released for a home console. In that regard it was kind of a disappointment, but it’s not a bad game, just more of the same.

snippet.textDisplay: It was okay but the music is rly great.
snippet.textOriginal: It was okay but the music is rly great.

snippet.textDisplay: It's a low budget game when it seriously should NOT be low budget. Some parts of the story feel rushed, character animations are poor, textures are overall low quality and the main game is very short. It's never been this easy to get pokemon ready for online battles, at least!
snippet.textOriginal: It's a low budget game when it seriously should NOT be low budget. Some parts of the story feel rushed, character animations are poor, textures are overall low quality and the main game is very short. It's never been this easy to get pokemon ready for online battles, at least!

snippet.textDisplay: The games are fine, but considering the budget are also severely disappointing. The story felt rushed and compared to older games, the lack of post-game is pretty pathetic. Music is nice though and at the end of the day it's still Pokémon.
snippet.textOriginal: The games are fine, but considering the budget are also severely disappointing. The story felt rushed and compared to older games, the lack of post-game is pretty pathetic. Music is nice though and at the end of the day it's still Pokémon.
